detailed_info.name: Cocamidopropyl betaine
detailed_info.description:
Betaine cocamidopropyl or CAPB is amphoteric surfactant often used in shower gels and shampoos as a secondary TA. It has softened more aggressive surfactants such as sulfated anionics such as Sodium Laureth Sulfate or Sodium Lauryl Sulfate. This surfactant is made from coconut oil derivative and dimethylaminopropylamine, which does not make it a natural compound.
It is one of the ingredients that is an exception in the COSMOS specifications: it is authorized in organic.
detailed_info.reference:
Fiche de sécurité du Cocamidopropyl betaine - http://www.chimieplus.com/base/fichepdf/fds29004.pdf

CNESST - https://www.csst.qc.ca/prevention/reptox/Pages/fiche-complete.aspx?no_produit=408278

INRS - http://www.inrs.fr/dms/inrs/PDF/bdd-demeter/DEM-137/DEM%20137.pdf

functions.name: Antistatic
functions.description: Reduces static electricity by neutralizing electrical charge on a surface

functions.name: Cleansing
functions.description: Helps to keep a clean surface

functions.name: Foam boosting
functions.description: Improves the quality of the foam produced by increasing one or more of the following properties: volume, texture and/or stability

functions.name: Hair conditioning
functions.description: Leaves hair easy to comb, soft, soft and shiny and / or confers volume, lightness and shine

functions.name: Surfactant
functions.description: Reduces the surface tension of cosmetics and contributes to the even distribution of the product when it is used

functions.name: Viscosity controlling
functions.description: Increases or decreases the viscosity of cosmetics

functions.name: Skin conditioning - miscellaneous
functions.description: Improving the appearance of dry and/or damaged skin by reducing flaking and restoring its suppleness.

detailed_info.name: Betaine
detailed_info.description: Betaine is used in cosmetics for its moisturizing power and its ability to protect the skin from irritation. It is also used in hair care to give them volume, improve their behavior and resistance. It is synthesized naturally by many plants, but also by some crustaceans. It is usually extracted from sugar beet or sugar cane.

functions.description: Reduces static electricity by neutralizing electrical charge on a surface

functions.name: Hair conditioning
functions.description: Leaves hair easy to comb, soft, soft and shiny and / or confers volume, lightness and shine

functions.name: Humectant
functions.description: Maintains water content of a cosmetic both in its packaging and on the skin

functions.name: Skin conditioning
functions.description: Maintains skin in good condition

functions.name: Viscosity controlling
functions.description: Increases or decreases the viscosity of cosmetics

detailed_info.name: Coco-betaine
detailed_info.description: Coco betaine is an amphoteric surfactant of natural origin (coconut derivative). It improves the foam and has antistatic properties in hair care. It is often used in natural products with decyl glucoside (non-ionic surfactant) and coco glucoside (non-ionic surfactant). It is authorized in organic products.
